questions.question_text:
The reaction rate for the reaction

[PtCl4]2$$-$$ + H2O $$\rightleftharpoons$$ [Pt(H2O)Cl3]$$-$$ + Cl$$-$$

was measured as a function of concentrations of different species. It was observed that $${{ - d\left[ {{{\left[ {PtC{l_4}} \right]}^{2 - }}} \right]} \over {dt}} = 4.8 \times {10^{ - 5}}\left[ {{{\left[ {PtC{l_4}} \right]}^{2 - }}} \right] - 2.4 \times {10^{ - 3}}\left[ {{{\left[ {Pt({H_2}O)C{l_3}} \right]}^ - }} \right]\left[ {C{l^ - }} \right]$$.

where square brackets are used to denote molar concentrations. The equilibrium constant Kc = ____________ . (Nearest integer)
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: The reaction rate for the reaction[PtCl_{4}]^{2$$-$$} + H_{2}O $$\rightleftharpoons$$ [Pt(H_{2}O)Cl_{3}]^{$$-$$} + Cl^{$$-$$}was measured as a function of concentrations of different species. It was observed that $${{ - d\left[ {{{\left[ {PtC{l_4}} \right]}^{2 - }}} \right]} \over {dt}} = 4.8 \times {10^{ - 5}}\left[ {{{\left[ {PtC{l_4}} \right]}^{2 - }}} \right] - 2.4 \times {10^{ - 3}}\left[ {{{\left[ {Pt({H_2}O)C{l_3}} \right]}^ - }} \right]\left[ {C{l^ - }} \right]$$.where square brackets are used to denote molar concentrations. The equilibrium constant K_{c} = ____________ . (Nearest integer)

questions.question_text: In the given circuit the AC source has $$\omega$$ = 100 rad s-1. Considering the inductor and capacitor to be ideal, what will be the current I flowing through the circuit?

questions.question_text: Two blocks of masses 3 kg and 5 kg are connected by a metal wire going over a smooth pulley. The breaking stress of the metal is $${{24} \over \pi } \times {10^2}$$ Nm-2. What is the minimum radius of the wire ? (Take g = 10 ms-2)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Two blocks of masses 3 kg and 5 kg are connected by a metal wire going over a smooth pulley. The breaking stress of the metal is $${{24} \over \pi } \times {10^2}$$ Nm^{-2}. What is the minimum radius of the wire ? (Take g = 10 ms^{-2})

questions.question_text:
Two waves are simultaneously passing through a string and their equations are : 

y1 = A1 sin k(x $$-$$ vt), y2 = A2 sin k(x $$-$$ vt + x0). Given amplitudes A1 = 12 mm and A2 = 5 mm, x0 = 3.5 cm and wave number k = 6.28 cm$$-$$1. The amplitude of resulting wave will be ................ mm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Two waves are simultaneously passing through a string and their equations are : y_{1} = A_{1} sin k(x $$-$$ vt), y_{2} = A_{2} sin k(x $$-$$ vt + x_{0}). Given amplitudes A_{1} = 12 mm and A_{2} = 5 mm, x_{0} = 3.5 cm and wave number k = 6.28 cm^{$$-$$1}. The amplitude of resulting wave will be ................ mm.

questions.question_text: A source of light is placed in front of a screen. Intensity of light on the screen is I. Two Polaroids P1 and P2 are so placed in between the source of light and screen that the intensity of light on screen is I/2. P2 should be rotated by an angle of (degrees) so that the intensity of light on the screen becomes $${{3I} \over 8}$$.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A source of light is placed in front of a screen. Intensity of light on the screen is I. Two Polaroids P_{1} and P_{2} are so placed in between the source of light and screen that the intensity of light on screen is I/2. P_{2} should be rotated by an angle of (degrees) so that the intensity of light on the screen becomes $${{3I} \over 8}$$.

questions.question_text:
If the maximum value of accelerating potential provided by a ratio frequency oscillator is 12 kV. The number of revolution made by a proton in a cyclotron to achieve one sixth of the speed of light is ...............

[mp = 1.67 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$27 kg, e = 1.6 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$19C, Speed of light = 3 $$\times$$ 108 m/s]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: If the maximum value of accelerating potential provided by a ratio frequency oscillator is 12 kV. The number of revolution made by a proton in a cyclotron to achieve one sixth of the speed of light is ...............[m_{p} = 1.67 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$27} kg, e = 1.6 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$19}^{}C, Speed of light = 3 $$\times$$ 10^{8} m/s]

questions.question_text: The acceleration due to gravity is found upto an accuracy of 4% on a planet. The energy supplied to a simple pendulum to known mass 'm' to undertake oscillations of time period T is being estimated. If time period is measured to an accuracy of 3%, the accuracy to which E is known as ..............%
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: A circular coil of radius 8.0 cm and 20 turns is rotated about its vertical diameter with an angular speed of 50 rad s$$-$$1 in a uniform horizontal magnetic field of 3.0 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 T. The maximum emf induced the coil will be ................. $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 volt (rounded off to the nearest integer)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A circular coil of radius 8.0 cm and 20 turns is rotated about its vertical diameter with an angular speed of 50 rad s^{$$-$$1} in a uniform horizontal magnetic field of 3.0 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$2} T. The maximum emf induced the coil will be ................. $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$2} volt (rounded off to the nearest integer)

questions.question_text:
Two simple harmonic motions are represented by the equations

 $${x_1} = 5\sin \left( {2\pi t + {\pi  \over 4}} \right)$$ and $${x_2} = 5\sqrt 2 (\sin 2\pi t + \cos 2\pi t)$$. The amplitude of second motion is ................ times the amplitude in first motion.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Two simple harmonic motions are represented by the equations $${x_1} = 5\sin \left( {2\pi t + {\pi  \over 4}} \right)$$ and $${x_2} = 5\sqrt 2 (\sin 2\pi t + \cos 2\pi t)$$. The amplitude of second motion is ................ times the amplitude in first motion.

questions.question_text: A coil in the shape of an equilateral triangle of side 10 cm lies in a vertical plane between the pole pieces of permanent magnet producing a horizontal magnetic field 20 mT. The torque acting on the coil when a current of 0.2 A is passed through it and its plane becomes parallel to the magnetic field will be $$\sqrt x $$ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$5 Nm. The value of x is .................
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text:
An object is placed at a distance of 12 cm from a convex lens. A convex mirror of focal length 15 cm is placed on other side of lens at 8 cm as shown in the figure. Image of object coincides with the object.


When the convex mirror is removed, a real and inverted image is formed at a position. The distance of the image from the object will be .............. (cm)
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: The coefficient of static friction between two blocks is 0.5 and the table is smooth. The maximum horizontal force that can be applied to move the blocks together is .................. N. (take g = 10 ms-2)
